summary: Vitamin C, found in citrus fruits and veggies, is essential for our bodies. It helps fix tissues, make collagen, and produce certain brain chemicals. We need it for our immune system and it acts as an antioxidant. Most animals make their own, but humans and some others must get it from food. It's used to prevent and treat scurvy. You can take it as a supplement, but large doses might cause stomach upset and other issues. Discovered in 1912, it was the first vitamin made in a lab in 1933.
title: Vitamin C
